name: Frogatt, Curbar and White Edge Red Deer Circular Walk, Longshaw Estate

ai.summary: A strenuous 31.3 km circular ridge walk on the Longshaw Estate, passing Froggatt Edge, Curbar Edge and White Edge with potential red deer sightings. Expect long ascents, exposed sections and varied moorland and gritstone terrain; a challenging route for experienced hikers with good fitness.
ai.terrain_summary: Primarily ridges and moorland with rocky ledges and uneven, grassy paths. Sections are exposed with open-sky views and potential boggy patches; weather can be windy and changeable. The route follows the major gritstone edges around Longshaw Estate—Froggatt Edge, Curbar Edge and White Edge—with gates and occasional bridleways; navigation and sturdy footwear are essential.
ai.safety_notes: This is a long, exposed ridge walk. Check the forecast and daylight hours before setting out. Carry a map and navigation tools, and know your route. Stay on marked paths, watch footing on rocky sections, and be prepared for sudden weather changes. Red deer may be present—give them space. Keep dogs under control and inform someone of your planned route and expected return time.
recommended_gear: Sturdy hiking boots with good grip
Map and compass or GPS device
Fully charged phone with emergency contacts
Trekking poles (optional but helpful on ridges)
ai.best_seasons: Spring to autumn (roughly April–October) when daylight and trail conditions are generally more favorable; winter trips can be challenging due to ice, wind and short days.

seo.title: Frogatt, Curbar and White Edge Red Deer Circular Walk – 31.3 km Ridge Walk on Longshaw Estate, UK
seo.meta_description: Take on a 31.3 km hard circular ridge walk across Longshaw Estate visiting Froggatt, Curbar and White Edge with possible red deer sightings. Exposed and rewarding.
seo.h1: Frogatt, Curbar and White Edge Red Deer Circular Walk, Longshaw Estate
